cheatsheet.title: Launch R Console on Eclipse Startup

intro.description:
This cheat sheet shows how one can configure Eclipse to launch an R console whenever Eclipse is started.
Note: The 'Auto Run'-Feature (WalWare.de) must be installed for this setup.

item.title: Select Launch Configuration
item.description:
Go to Preferences > Run/Debug > Autorun.
Check the option Enable run at startup of:.
Select the configuration listed under the R Console node that you would like to launch at startup. This configuration and its R environment has to be defined previously in order to be able to select it for an automated launch.
Click on the Apply and OK button and this R console will automatically be launched on each Eclipse startup.
